definition: abbr. for 日本[Ri4 ben3], Japan
circle/round/circular/spherical/(of the moon) full/unit of Chinese currency (yuan)/tactful/to make consistent and whole (the narrative of a dream or a lie)

sentences.english: On Thursday, the yen selloff gave other Asian currencies a breather.
sentences.chinese: 周四，日圆抛售潮让亚洲其他货币松了口气。

sentences.english: The company's net loss widened marginally to 25.5 billion yen.
sentences.chinese: 该公司净亏损小幅扩大到255亿日圆。

sentences.english: Hebe:How come the Japanese yen has inflated so much?
sentences.chinese: 怎么最近日圆汇率涨那么多啊？

sentences.english: The foreign exchange clerk has just given the customer the exchange rate for changing Japanese yen into US dollars.
sentences.chinese: 兑换外币的行员刚把日圆兑换成美金的汇率告诉顾客。

sentences.english: He also plans to make proposals for taking advantage of the strong yen.
sentences.chinese: 他还计划提出如何借助日圆走强获益的议案。

sentences.english: As long as the yen yawns, it will be hard for Tokyo to act.
sentences.chinese: 只要日圆不动，东京将难以采取行动。

sentences.english: The yen's strength causes little jubilation in Japan.
sentences.chinese: 日圆走强并没给日本带来欢欣鼓舞。

sentences.english: Is the Dollar Set to Become the New …
sentences.chinese: 美元势将成为下一个日圆？

sentences.english: This suggests that FX intervention may not be as successful given that the market is already short JPY.
sentences.chinese: 由于市场已在沽售日圆，外汇干预不太可能成功。

sentences.english: The BOJ intervened to combat JPY strength and increased the amount of its asset purchases yet again.
sentences.chinese: 日本央行也出手干预日圆升值，再度提升资产收购量。

definition: peso (currency in Latin America) (loanword)/also written 比索[bi3 suo3]
